author: potuz
content:
I have a couple of questions regarding decentralized trading. I asked on reddit and a couple of Discord channels and didn't get any answers.
1) is there some platform like uniswap but where one is allowed to submit a limit bid order, say to exchange N tokens X for M tokens Y, one deposits the tokens X into an audited contract until a matching order appears or until the order is cancelled. It seems to me that contract technology is capable of this and that there should be demand for this so I presume this exists.
2) similar questions for options: I hold N token X and want to sell a call option at with strike M tokens Y for price L tokens Z. I deposit my tokens X into a contract and if someone wants to buy he deposits the tokens Z. The contract then a) gives me L tokens Z, b) mints N new tokens OptionX and gives it to the buyer. If the buyer wants to execute it deposits back the tokens along with the tokens Y, then the contract gives him my tokens X, i receive Y and option X is burned. 
I haven't seen any of this, but I'm very new to Ethereum and have never traded (nor am I interested, in any case I'd be more interested in implementing this)

author: sky.cactus
content: What you have described is possible, though the latter requires an oracle which has some security issues that you have to consider.  There are a number of apps that solve both problems, but this server isn't the right place to learn about them.  I think there are DeFi discord servers, or just search the internet and see what you find.  Maybe start by looking into `1inch.exchange` which is reasonably reputable and maybe branch out from there?

author: potuz
content: I don't see the need of an oracle?

author: potuz
content: The decision to execute the option is entirely up to the buyer

author: potuz
content: At any price

author: potuz
content: Even if he loses at market value

author: sky.cactus
content: Ah, American options are a bit easier.  I was thinking European options.

author: potuz
content: What I am asking is because I'm a bit surprised that something obviously possible and with clear demand I haven't found, i just assume that anything satisfying these two assumptions has already been done

author: sky.cactus
content: I have heard of numerous solutions to both problems in the form of dapps.  I just don't do the whole DeFi thing so I can't help direct you to them, and this isn't really the right server to be asking for pointers on where to go to DeFi.  ðŸ™‚

author: potuz
content: It seems 1inch has something like a "bid" order so I guess it does solve 1 at least for some pairs of tokens.  I'll gather some time later to look into some defi discord to ask as well

author: cryptoblockchaintechnologies
content: The term MEV can be misleading as one would assume it is miners who are extracting this value. In reality, the MEV present on Ethereum today is predominantly captured by DeFi traders through structural arbitrage trading strategies; miners indirectly profit from these tradersâ€™ transaction fees. One example of such structural arbitrage opportunities are Uniswap price arbitrage trades: when a Uniswap poolâ€™s assets become mispriced, a profit opportunity is created to arbitrage the Uniswap pool back to parity with other trading venues. Of course, rather than letting the trader pay them a transaction fee for the privilege of collecting the arb profit, a miner could simply decide to run this strategy themselves.

author: zerowei4320
content: Mev refers more to the miner seeing this transaction in the mempool. Computing the transactions needed to front run for maximum alpha and then constructing a block and submit those perfectly timed txns for the lowest possible gwei, thus letting the trader do all the work and you extract all the value.

author: zerowei4320
content: Thatâ€™s mev

author: zerowei4320
content: The trader is being a trader; the miner is being a vampire.

author: zerowei4320
content: Itâ€™s even better when traders send stupid high gas costs only for the txn to fail on the final check for returns. So miners also include those failing txns right after to ensure they gobble the fees.

author: zerowei4320
content: So if as a miner you arenâ€™t doing this. Invest the effort. 1559 is gonna slash extractable alpha anyways with the base fee . May as well go make all you can. The txn fee debate is a waste of time and energy. Go get rich instead.
